definition: high ball/lob (in tennis)/golf (abbr. of 高爾夫球|高尔夫球[gao1 er3 fu1 qiu2])

sentences.english: This leads to a lot of high and very attackable returns from your opponent.
sentences.chinese: 對手送回來的球多爲可以受你攻擊的中高球。

sentences.english: How often do you see them aiming high balls up front?
sentences.chinese: 曼聯經常向前傳高球嗎？

sentences.english: Nike Golf outfitted the triumphant U. S. Ryder Cup team.
sentences.chinese: 耐吉高球團隊爲冠軍隊伍美國萊德杯隊設計比賽球服。

sentences.english: Bourbon and branch is a drink prepared in a highball glass made with bourbon and spring water.
sentences.chinese: 這款雞尾酒是把波本威士忌和純淨水倒在高球杯裏。

sentences.english: Ultimately the best defense is a style of play that precludes lifting to the back.
sentences.chinese: 最後，對於最好的防守就是不要起高球到後場。

sentences.english: The German outside-right lobs the ball to the goal.
sentences.chinese: 德國隊的右邊鋒往門前吊高球。

definition: to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
to serve the ball/to tee off
ten-pin bowling/bowling ball/(baseball etc) ground ball
open ball (math.)/to start a ball game/to kick off (soccer)/to tee off (golf)
to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
